alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 9:23AM EDT until July 26 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Johnson and Martin. In southeast Kentucky, Breathitt, Floyd, Magoffin and Pike. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 923 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paintsville, Prestonsburg, Salyersville, Inez, Mason, Coal Run Village, Martin, Warfield, Allen, Lancer, Cliff, Bays Branch, Auxier, Corn Fork Hollow, Nero, Dwale, Emma, Oaklawn Estates, East Point and Alvin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
